Authors: Hiroshi Masumoto, Yoshihito Ohmura, Yousuke Degawa
Title:
Lichenomphalia meridionalis (Hygrophoraceae, lichenized
Basidiomycota) new to Asia
Abstract:
Lichenomphalia meridionalis, a lichenized basidiomycete,
is reported as new to Asia. It was found on Andosol soil along a road
bank at elevation from 1,200 to 1,900 m in Nagano and Yamanashi
Prefectures, central Japan. A molecular phylogenetic analysis of
Japanese samples based on the nrLSU sequence showed that L. meridionalis
was genetically distinct from L. grisella and L. oreades. Lichenomphalia
meridionalis has been known exclusively from Mediterranean countries,
but our finding showed that L. meridionalis could be widely distributed
than previously thought.
